meanings.definition: A line of people waiting to receive free or low-cost food, typically bread.
meanings.sent1: The long breadlines outside the food bank showed the high demand for assistance.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the breadlines formed outside the charity organization.
meanings.sent3: The breadlines at the community center were so long that they looked like a colorful snake winding through the street.
meanings.sent4: As the economy struggled, the breadlines grew longer and longer, painting a stark picture of poverty.
meanings.sent5: The image of the breadlines etched itself into the minds of the townspeople, a symbol of hardship and resilience.

meanings.definition: To form a line or queue in order to receive food assistance.
meanings.sent1: People would breadlines outside the shelter every evening, hoping for a warm meal.
meanings.sent2: During the crisis, many families had to breadlines for the first time in their lives.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to breadlines in the cafeteria, pretending to wait for a feast.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, communities come together to breadlines and support each other.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers worked tirelessly to organize the breadlines efficiently, ensuring everyone got the help they needed.
